New Records: Jos Buttler scored 73 runs for England in the match.
Sam Curran took 2 wickets and scored 6 runs in 4 overs.
Key Match Events: Sam Curran dismissed Glenn Phillips, a key turning point in the match.
England's seamers, including Sam Curran and Chris Woakes, were exceptional in the final overs.
Pre-Game Insights: England won the toss and elected to bat first.
England's strategy involved batting deep and taking wickets earlier to control the game.
Post-Match Reflections: Kane Williamson praised England's performance and said they played beautifully under pressure.
Jos Buttler reflected on the team's resilience and confidence after the win.
Miscellaneous Highlights: The match was the 33rd match in Group 1 of the ICC Men's T20 World Cup 2022-23.
The victory kept England in contention for the semi-finals.
Others: The match was played at the Brisbane Cricket Ground (Woolloongabba) on November 1, 2022.
